hackathon-description-text: Come spend the night building and learning with us!  DevFest, Columbia's annual week-long festival of learning and hacking, ends with a hackathon, where you get the chance to apply what you've learned and create something awesome.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Chief Data Scientist, New York Times

hackathon-rules: Our code of conduct can be found here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-TF1rVlgKrVmckPZqf24qwLsZdly_bhnY6fzol67mtA/edit.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $2000 to be split by team members.
$1500 to be split by team members.
$1000 to be split by team members.
Cloth-bound data science book set autographed by Edward Tufte for the team with the best tool to advance journalism, sponsored by The Brown Institute.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: The Best Tool to Advance Journalism

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Feature on the NYC Open Data Blog for the team with the best NYC project, sponsored by NYC Open Data.
Snapchat Spectacles for each member of the team with the best beginner hack, sponsored by ADI.
$100 Airbnb gift cards for each member of the team with the most technically challenging hack, sponsored by a16z.
Xbox One and Games for the team with the best use of Microsoft APIs, sponsored by Microsoft.
Raspberry Pi for each member of the team with the best biomedically-inspired project, sponsored by BMES.

Invitation to pitch to the RDV team (chance of up to $25k investment) and/or dinner with the RDV team and local VCs for the team most likely to be the next big thing, sponsored by Rough Draft Ventures.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Likely to be the "Next Big Thing"

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Mebo robots for each member of the team with the best app for social good (education, environemnt, non-profit, government, or community focused), sponsored by Bloomberg.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: PHILhack: The Best App for Social Good

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $100 American Express gift cards for each member of team that is Facebook's favorite hack, sponsored by Facebook.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3022 Broadway, New York, NY 10027, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this a new idea? Has it been done before?
How useful is this idea? Can we see it being used in real life?

hackathon-description-header: The 18-hour hackathon that concludes DevFest's week of hacking and learning -- come build with us!
hackathon-location-description: Columbia University -- Uris Hall, Business and Economics Library
